ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Installing cantera...
ygData.msgSnippet: Dan, I too am finding a problem building on linux, but it is a little different than the problem you describe. However, it occurs at the same point - trying to

Dan,

I too am finding a problem building on linux, but it is a little  
different than the problem you describe. However, it occurs at the  
same point - trying to link demos.cpp.

On my machine:
uname -m=i686
uname -r=2.6.11-1.1369_FC4
uname-s=Linux

I checked out a fresh working copy of Cantera, and edited the  
'preconfig' script only to turn off using sundials. I then ran:

./predef
make

For me, the problem is that the system does not seem to be able to  
find the "stdc++" libraries.  If I specify the library as "-lstdc++"  
the build fails, and the functions it says it can't find are ones in  
this library.  If I explicitly add file "/usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6" to  
the build command line, then the build of the demo program succeeds.

I don't think this is a Cantera error, since I believe specifying "- 
lstdc++" should cause the linker to look for both static (.a) and  
dynamic (.so) libraries.  But I don't know what causes it.  I will  
explore a bit more.

I don't know if this error has the same cause as the one you are  
getting.  I would recommend checking out a fresh version (rather than  
updating from CVS) and trying to build.

Any linux gurus out there know what is going on here?

(For what it is worth, this problem seems to be specific to linux; I  
don't encounter any problem building Cantera on Mac OSX, either on  
Intel or PPC machines.)

Dave




On Jun 7, 2006, at 4:44 PM, Dan Smyth wrote:

> I'm tyring to install cantera on a Linux machine:
> uname -m = i686
> uname -r = 2.6.9-22.ELsmp
> uname -s = Linux
> I updated from CVS today and got the following errors after copying
> loads of *.h files to where they needed to go and adding some "ar ruv"
> and "ranlib" commands to where they used to be in the Makefile of
> Cantera-1.6.
>
> make[2]: Entering directory
> `/auto/grp4/HMX_propellants/cantera/Cantera/cxx/demos'
> g++ -c demos.cpp
> -I/fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include -g -O2
> In file included from rankine.cpp:7,
>                  from demos.cpp:7:
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:15:
> error: expected class-name before '{' token
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:
> In constructor `Cantera::PureFluid::PureFluid(std::string,  
> std::string)':
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:24:
> error: cannot convert `Cantera::PureFluid* const' to
> `Cantera::ThermoPhase*' for argument `4' to `bool
> Cantera::buildSolutionFromXML(Cantera::XML_Node&, std::string,
> std::string, Cantera::ThermoPhase*, Cantera::Kinetics*)'
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:
> In constructor `Cantera::PureFluid::PureFluid(Cantera::XML_Node&,
> std::string)':
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:31:
> error: cannot convert `Cantera::PureFluid* const' to
> `Cantera::ThermoPhase*' for argument `4' to `bool
> Cantera::buildSolutionFromXML(Cantera::XML_Node&, std::string,
> std::string, Cantera::ThermoPhase*, Cantera::Kinetics*)'
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:
> In function `std::ostream& Cantera::operator<<(std::ostream&,
> Cantera::PureFluid&)':
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> PureFluid.h:39:
> error: invalid initialization of reference of type 'const
> Cantera::ThermoPhase&' from expression of type 'Cantera::PureFluid'
> /fsh/das69/groups/HMX_propellants/cantera/build/include/cantera/ 
> kernel/stringUtils.h:28:
> error: in passing argument 1 of `std::string Cantera::report(const
> Cantera::ThermoPhase&, bool)'
> In file included from demos.cpp:7:
> rankine.cpp: In function `int openRankine(int, void*)':
> rankine.cpp:48: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_TP'
> rankine.cpp:52: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_SP'
> rankine.cpp:55: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_HP'
> rankine.cpp:59: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_Psat'
> rankine.cpp:63: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_SP'
> rankine.cpp:67: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'setState_HP'
> rankine.cpp: In function `void saveState(F&, std::string) [with F =
> Cantera::Water]':
> rankine.cpp:49:   instantiated from here
> rankine.cpp:20: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'enthalpy_mass'
> rankine.cpp:21: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named
> 'entropy_mass'
> rankine.cpp:22: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named

> rankine.cpp:23: error: 'class Cantera::Water' has no member named

> make[1]: Leaving directory
> `/auto/grp4/HMX_propellants/cantera/Cantera/cxx'
> make: *** [cxxlib] Error 2
>
> I'm just having a booger of time figuring this out.  Any help would be
> most appreciated.  Thanks.
>
> Dan Smyth
